reviewText: I have no problems with the seller,but this DVD & others was produced & marketed without sound.I've ordered from 3 different sources & had the same problem.Great video-NO sound.Seller refunded promptly.Seller A++.

Title: N/A

reviewText: Wow..what a story!..unlike most "Behind The Music" type Rock & Roll stories with battling band members, drug abuse and worse it is refreshing to hear the intimate tale of a hit group that LOVED EACH OTHER and stayed together for 40+ years until death tore them apart..Tops member DUKE FAKIR tells the story with heart and soul.GREAT rare performances, some live and some which were originally lip synced were RE-lip synced with the amazing original MOTOWN masters instead of the thin TV audio of the day. Brilliant idea and very well executed.Just the originally MOTOWN years are covered here and only a brief mention of their ABC DUNHILL and later MOTOWN period . i LOVE this DVD !!!!!!!

reviewText: I love the four tops and was looking forward to listening to and watching the dvd. I was so disappointed when it had no sound. once again a hassle free return with amazon.
Title: N/A

reviewText: What a long wait we have had to go through for this FOUR TOPS reflection DVD back to the 60's and early 70's performances, it has been most unfortunate that early reaction was soured by the audio problems. Thanks to Jeff at Universal and also DVD King here for explaining it so clearly, but not all who purchase this DVD will read our reviews here, I have not experienced this problem on other Motown Artist Reflection DVD'sBack to THE FOUR TOPS and any performance for me would be A ++ and it so good to see these cuts from the 60's especially. My first single I ever bought aged 12 was "Baby I Need Your Loving" by the FOUR TOPS a re-release and they were my first live concert aged 14 which I travelled 28 miles (a long way at that age) on my own without telling anyone. Never then did I think it would lead to be coming a Teen Radio DJ and playing the FOUR TOPS music I loved and getting to meet and interview them so many times.I just wish that the main programme though would not have been done as a documentary style presentation, also I feel there are some better cuts of some of the performances such as "Ask The Lonely" which is my all time favourite track.Yes I like others have paid a lot of money for every FOUR TOPS release possible on DVD and this is a good price and a welcome release, it just saddens me for production and editing I can only give it 4 out of 5, but that does not reflect on THE FOUR TOPS and should not put anyone off purchasing this DVD.LEVI STUBB'S become a Friend and will be sadly missed, I feel as if part of my own life has been cut away, but No One can take away the warm memories he gave and now has left us, just to see his smile in this DVD is worth the price alone - we will miss You Levi, but Thanks! for all you gave us - Buy This DVD!

reviewText: As a fan and friend of the Four Tops for 42 years, I highly recommend that you buy this DVD now.  It is marvelous!  I have paid $125-$250 for their other DVDs on public television telethons.  Don't be sorry.  Enliven your holidays with a "blast from the past."
summary: Buy It Now or Be Sorry!

reviewText: I had  chance to see the Tops in their prime,back in 69 and they put on a great show. This is well worth watching if you are a fan of their music.

reviewText: For all us "Boomers" nothing brings back so many great memories as sitting down, drinking a few "cold ones" and watching a great concert video like this one. The Four Tops were and are one of my top five groups. This copulation of their best hits will have you dancing and bring back a flood of happy memories.
Title: N/A

reviewText: After having purchased other products from UMG : The Temptations, Smokey & the Miracles and The Supremes, I was jazzed when I purchased The Four Tops. The songs are a well rounded bag of hits from different sources. The problem is in the interview section with Smokey and some other artist, which was so badly out of audio sync and so unwatchable that I returned the dvd and got a refund. I'm assuming my copy was not the only one as someone else here has complained about the same issue. Don't these companys have any sense of product quality? Too bad I really wanted to have this for my collection, but I'll wait till it hits the bargain bins or the audio sync issue is corrected.Times are tough, money is tight, so please don't put out a product like this, its an insult to us as fans and most of all to the late and great artists.
Title: N/A

reviewText: The performances are great and the background info by Abdul "Duke" Fakir and former Motown personnel are great before each song. The only problem is that in the special features section the "bonus interviews" are interesting but the video and audio are not in sync. Which is why this only rates four stars.
